short_summary: Public Services and Procurement Canada are inviting bidders to a selection of RFQ and RFP and NDA document
full_summary:
# Request for Information (RFI) for the Laboratory Information Management System

## Overview
Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) is seeking industry input regarding the proposed requirements for a Laboratory Information Management System (LIMS). This Request for Information (RFI) is not a bid solicitation nor a Request for Proposal (RFP), and no agreement or contract will be entered into based on this RFI.

## Purpose
The purpose of this RFI is to gather feedback from industry experts on the proposed requirements for the LIMS, which is intended to support the needs of Statistics Canada (StatCan) for laboratory information management. PSPC will use the feedback received to inform the development of a draft Request for Proposal (RFP) that will be posted subsequently.

## Requirements

PSPC is seeking comments, concerns, and recommendations from industry experts regarding the following:

*   The proposed requirements for the LIMS
*   Alternative solutions or approaches to meeting the requirements
*   Comments on the content, format, and organization of the draft documents included in the RFI

## Submission Instructions

Respondents are requested to submit their feedback through CanadaBuys (SAP Ariba) to the contracting authority by the deadline indicated on the first page of the RFI. PSPC will not reimburse respondents for expenses incurred in responding to this RFI.

## Contact Information

For any questions or clarifications regarding the RFI, please contact:

*   Kwesi Wiafe, Contracting Authority
*   Email: [kwesi.wiafe@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:kwesi.wiafe@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)
*   Phone: [insert phone number]
*   Fax: [insert fax number]

## Important Notes

*   This RFI is not a bid solicitation, and PSPC will not necessarily respond to enquiries in writing or by circulating answers to all potential suppliers.
*   The issuance of this RFI is not a commitment by the Government of Canada to enter into a contract for the work described herein.
*   The feedback received from respondents will be used to inform the development of a draft RFP, which will be posted subsequently.
